desc: RRAS2, a small GTPase, is altered frequently by amplification or missense mutations in various cancers (MSKCC cBioPortal, January, 2017).

RRAS2 encodes a small GTPase protein, alsoknown as TC21, belonging to the R-Ras subfamily of Ras-like GTPases. TC21 islocalized to plasma membrane, and activates the mitogen-activated proteinkinase (MAPK) and JNK signaling cascades via its interaction with c-Raf-1 aswell as the phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase (PI3-K)-Akt pathway in order tomediate transformation and differentiation in diverse cell types (PMID: 10557073,11850823). RRas2 mutations in positions analogous to those present in other RAS oncogenes show high levels of transforming activity and also induce transcriptional activation from Ras-responsive promoter elements (PMID: 8196649). Oncogenic mutations in RRAS2 are occasionally found in tumorcell lines (PMID: 8052619, 7478545), and RRAS2 amplification is found in manycell lines derived from breast cancer (PMID: 8552388).

articles.title: TC21 mediates transformation and cell survival via activation of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase/Akt and NF-kappaB signaling pathway.
articles.reference: Rong R et al. Oncogene. 2002 Feb 7;21(7)1062-70.

articles.title: Aberrant function of the Ras-related protein TC21/R-Ras2 triggers malignant transformation.
